translations.idiomatic: Yu Qing replied: 'I have heard that when small states deal with large states, if there is profit then the large state receives the blessing, if there is defeat then the small state receives the calamity.

translations.literal: Now Wei with small country request its calamity, wang with big country decline its blessing, minister therefore say wang wrong, Wei also wrong.
translations.idiomatic: Now Wei, as a small state, requests its own calamity, while Your Majesty, as a large state, declines its blessing. Therefore I say Your Majesty is wrong, and Wei is also wrong.

translations.idiomatic: Yu Qing, because of Wei Qi's matter, did not value the seal of a marquis of ten thousand households or the position of chancellor. He secretly traveled with Wei Qi, finally left Zhao, and was distressed in Liang.

translations.literal: Wei Qi already die, not obtain intention, then write book, up collect Chun Qiu, down observe near world, say section righteousness, name number, measure probe, govern strategy, altogether eight scrolls.
translations.idiomatic: After Wei Qi died and Yu Qing did not achieve his ambitions, he wrote a book, drawing from the Spring and Autumn Annals above and observing the recent world below, entitled Sections on Righteousness, Appellations, Assessment, and Political Strategy, in all eight scrolls.

translations.literal: Grand Historian say: Ping Yuan Jun, graceful graceful muddy world good noble son, yet not see big body.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Lord Pingyuan was a fine nobleman of graceful bearing in this troubled age, yet he did not perceive the larger picture.

translations.literal: Low saying: Profit make intelligence dim, Ping Yuan Jun greedy Feng Ting evil speech, make Zhao trap Chang Ping troops forty more ten thousand crowd, Han Dan almost perish.
translations.idiomatic: As the vulgar saying goes, 'Profit blinds the intellect.' Lord Pingyuan, greedy for Feng Ting's treacherous advice, caused Zhao to lose 400,000 troops at Changping, bringing Handan to the brink of destruction.

translations.idiomatic: Yu Qing assessed situations and gauged feelings, devising strategies for Zhao - how skillful he was!

translations.idiomatic: When he could not bear to abandon Wei Qi and ended up distressed in Daliang - even a common fellow would know this was impossible, how much more so a worthy man?
